faq.question: I am planning to start using , should I choose 2.x or the 3.0 version?
faq.answer: By all means, start with the 3.0 version. It offers much simpler Java API, better accompanying applications and documentation. The only reason you might want to stick with the 2.x line is when your software must run under JDK 1.4, which v3.0 does not support.

faq.question: Should I migrate my 2.x-based software to the 3.0 version?
faq.answer: If you'd like to take advantage of the improved clustering quality in version 3.0 and new features planned for further 3.x releases, you should migrate.

faq.question: How do I migrate my 2.x-based software to the 3.0 version?
faq.answer: If you are using Java API, download the 3.0 release Java API package and replace the calls to API in your software where appropriate. If you are using the Document Clustering Server (DCS), download the 3.0 release DCS run your software against it. The changes in the DCS API were very minor, mainly to introduce consistent parameter naming.

faq.question: What is the status of the 2.x version?
faq.answer: The 2.x line entered the maintenance mode with all new features being added to the 3.x line and the 2.x line being limited to bug fixes only.
